title: What do your mains say about you?
body:
Pick your three favorite champs...

...then we will tell you things about yourself based on who you've picked!

Edit: 

Please feel free to post replies to the champs! :D It's a big community, so just jump in wherever and let us know what you think those champs say about a player!

replies.body:
{{champion:21}} 
My main/best champion has always been Miss Fortune because I basically started with her and played her for almost a year non-stop. I learned the game by playing her with my friend who mains support. I guess I like the sarcastic character and swagger she has. I don't know what it says about me. I am a guy and somehow all the champions I play the most are women with few exceptions, no idea why...
---
Favorite ADCs (What I would consider my main role):
{{champion:21}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:15}} 

Favorite Mids:
{{champion:103}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:69}} 

Favorite Junglers:
{{champion:102}} {{champion:254}}{{champion:57}} (<-exception)

Favorite Supports:
{{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:37}} 

Favorite Top Lane (My weakest role):
{{champion:39}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:58}} (<-exception)
---
I play more champions than that, but those are the ones I play by far, the most... wow I play a lot of champions... 
---
{{champion:21}} (<-- but yeah, this is for sure my main gal, followed closely by Jinx.)
You are very confused about life. Pick 3 :P

I can take it. I swear.
{{champion:25}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:115}}
You're very careful about where and when you get involved in things, but when you do get involved it's not by accident and shit gets done.

Nothin says calculated like my legendary flash-zhonya and forgetting to ult with morgana

It's not about the lack of ult. It's about making a statement.

I don't think it'd matter whether or not you ulted. The enemy team wouldn't be able to deny that it was a

(•_•)

( •_•)>⌐■-■

(⌐■_■)

flashy play.

You seem twitchy, always ready to jump into a problem/conversation. You are upbeat, confident, and likes to freak out, but in your haste you might miss some certain details.

I would imagine you lose your keys a lot, then maybe that's just me @_@

I certainly have freaking out listed in my facebook interests.

You nailed it other than the keys thing, but that's because I attach them to my pants with a carabiner. #keymechanics
{{champion:8}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:53}}
Yer a bloody pain in the arse, bloke.... >.<

{{champion:8}} ...

bloody

{{champion:8}} ...


A+
Can't tell if you're guessing his blood type or...

That would be expunentially harder to do than the joke I made

Wait for it...
3 Months I've been waiting...
10 months later, I see the joke.
Ooh are you a new rioter?  If so, what do you do?

So far I've proven to be really good at eating pistachios and talking about {{champion:3}}.  Contrary to popular belief, the two are not mutually exclusive.

Officially, I'm a data scientist.  That means I science **ALL** the data.  I science it _good_.

Our team tries to use statistics and machine learning to help our designers and content creators understand how players use the stuff they make (LoL-the-game, champs, skins, eSports, fantasy, boards, ...).  If we're doing our job well, the data, analysis, and insights we provide will help Rioters update their already-substantial domain expertise and make even better stuff for players.

But, like I said, I'm new.  So far it's mostly pistachios.
What about pie charts? I hear they're delicious.
I'd say you like to do damage while still helping out your team with cc and defensive abilities :)
It's like you're staring straight into my soul =)

You're a loner with a heart of gold. Your loyalty and love for others makes you powerful; you have a purpose and you will not accept defeat. While your strengths include putting others first, you often forget to take care of yourself. You internalize problems and you are constantly searching for peace.
Thanks so much for weighing in!  Great job starting this thread and keeping up with it, it's a lot of fun to read.

You seem righteous and diligent, and while that may end up to be your shortcomings, it is also your greatest strength.

Wow, the more I write these the more they start sounding like horoscopes :P

Well it looks like you've got a future in the horoscope business if you want-- these are great!

Thanks again =)
{{champion:40}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:201}}

Strong willed and always putting others before yourself! You're the first person to step into a bad situation and defend the helpless. You are a fighter for justice...anyone would be lucky to call you their friend!
{{champion:84}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:4}}

You like trickery and guile.  You want to win by being clever.  Your biggest weakness is that if your plan goes wrong you'll die almost instantly, but you wouldn't have it any other way.  You want that danger, and the consequences for failure just make your victory sweeter.  You don't believe in a fair fight, and you engage in one as rarely as possible.
{{champion:16}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:32}}

Soraka was betrayed, Diana was excommunicated, Amumu is isolated. I think you relate to rejection and sadness, but respond with empathy and tenacity rather than bitterness.

Yes, no, maybe so?

People probably mistake you for a peaceful, harmless soul, and are unaware of the depths of your strength. You aren't to be trifled with, even if sometimes your compassion gets the better of you. When you latch upon something, you have a hard time letting go.
You are a wondering spirit looking for answers for questions you do not know. Always alone and on the lonely path. You search to make the world a better place, but is it ready to become such?

You like surprising your enemies.  You live for that moment when they thought they were going to get the double kill, but then BAM, heal out of nowhere.  Or that moment when the enemy jungler goes all-in on a sure thing, only to find out, nope, Diana out of nowhere.  You like disruptive plays and dramatic saves.  You like to go all-in yourself, but you're patient enough to choose a good moment to do it.

{{champion:99}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:267}} 

Hit me with your best shot!

You're not one for direct confrontation, but you'll come to a friend's aid in a heartbeat, maybe less. You're very empathetic, trusting and prefer being around a few good friends. You're very prone to smiling and if it wasn't for the lack of Leona I would also say a sunny and bright personality.

Haha, holy crap.

That's pretty damn near spot on. :D
What can I say, Psychology research + Game Design research (and a lot of Chinese take-out) is OP apparently, lol.

That's really cool. :3 

Mmmm, Chinese take-out. Now, I'm hungry. 

This is what I'm like when I'm hungry: 

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4735627
That's glorious, lol. And dangit, now I'm hungry too.....but I have to wait for this animation to render...first world problems lol.

Haha, it's okay, I have moments like that, too.

"I really want to get dinner, but my team isn't pushing to win. Guess I have to wait 10 more minutes."

Haha, really? This happens all too often to me. This is what happens when I decide to binge play. xD 

Back in college, when I was still living at home, my mom would always ask me to pause the game to help her with something. She didn't understand that it was live, and couldn't be paused.

She's a lot better now. She knows my rank, who I main, and who I've cosplayed. They grow up so fast. :3

My brother and I took over my parents theatre room at their house and had my Dad watching the LCS world finals last season. He still doesn't get it, but he is learning slowly.

But yeah, the "just pause it" thing came up a lot in our house, especially because when we were growing up, pausing was always an option with games. So they never understood it, LOL.
---
{{champion:21}}

That's awesome! I've had my mom watch some LCS before. She doesn't quite get it, either. Usually, she yells something along the lines of, "THAT'S LUX! YOU PLAY LUX!" 

My mom started me off with Nintendo, so pausing happened all the time. 

I remember when I told my mom I was going to be working on League of Legends. She used to give me crap all the time about staying up until 3am playing LoL with my friends. when I told her, I said, "So, I think it was pretty worth it, staying up all those nights playing, right?"

Best origin story goes to Riot KateyKhaos. Officially awarded. And yes, worth.

My Dad was just amazed that people were watching other people play video games in Staples Center. He had no idea what was going on, or who anyone was. His favorite games to play are Scrabble and Golf. 

Your mom sounds cool.
---
{{champion:21}}

:D 

My mom said the same thing, haha. She get bored of watching me play pretty easily, so she didn't get how people did it for hours. It also boggles her mind that people get paid to play video games professionally.

I think my mom's pretty cool. She loves all the music I do, and took me to see Blink182 for the first time when I was 11. She was in the mosh pit with me, and singing along. It was awesome. :D She also loves ska, and knows how to skank! #BestMomNA
{{champion:58}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:102}}

You seem to like being dependable, resilient. Each action has a definite and calculated process behind it, even if you don't notice. You are always ready to help out, but then again I don't need the champs to know that :P

-5 points for cheating Flint.

nah jk, love it :)
